articles.title: Congratulations to New Gabonese PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to New Gabonese PM
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the Cabinet of the DPRK, on Oct. 5 sent a congratulatory message to Emmanuel Issoze Ngondet upon his appointment as prime minister of Gabon.
					 The message expressed the will to positively cooperate with the new Gabonese prime minister to further develop the friendly and cooperative ties between the two countries and wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Foreign Ministry Spokesman Blasts Obama Group's Racket for Sanctions and Pressure upon DPRK
articles.content:
Foreign Ministry Spokesman Blasts Obama Group's Racket for Sanctions and Pressure upon DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK issued a statement on Thursday in connection with the fact that the Obama group's racket for sanctions and pressure on the DPRK has reached an extreme phase.
					 Far from drawing a lesson from its failed DPRK policy, the Obama group is threatening and blackmailing the DPRK by force of arms and is not hiding even the fact that it is seeking "a regime change" in the DPRK while daring hurt the dignity of its supreme leadership, the statement said, adding:
					
					 It is also making desperate efforts to isolate and stifle the DPRK by pressurizing other sovereign countries to sever relations with the DPRK or downgrade the level of ties with it.
					
					 This is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those who are on a losing streak in the political and military stand-off with the DPRK.
					
					 Defying universally accepted principle of international law that sovereign states can never be subject to jurisdiction of other countries under any circumstances, the Obama group is brandishing the sanctions stick against those countries disobedient to it. It is, indeed, a group of rogues.
					
					 In order to defend itself from the group of gangsters keen on inflicting even nuclear holocaust at the end of putting unprecedented political and economic pressure and military threats, the DPRK has bolstered the nuclear force both in quality and quantity after setting it as a national line to go nuclear and has now soared as a nuclear power possessed of powerful nuclear attack capabilities.
					
					 A stick has to be used against the horde of wolves like the U.S. which comes in fierce attack to eliminate the DPRK while categorically denying the sovereignty of the DPRK and its right to existence. Only then the U.S. will come to its senses.
					
					 The U.S. will sooner or later face a shuddering reality in which their bayonet that targeted the life of the people of the DPRK will boomerang on it.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao Party Leader
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao Party Leader
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Bounnhang Vorachith, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party, on the occasion of the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The floral basket was handed to Ri Su Yong, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Committee, by Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Phonekham Inthaboualy on Thursday.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps Here
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Diplomatic Corps Here
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the diplomatic corps here on the occasion of the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The floral basket and congratulatory letter were handed to Ri Su Yong, vice-chairman of the WPK Central Committee, by Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK who is doyen of the diplomatic corps, on Thursday.

articles.title: ASEAN Committee in DPRK Donates Aid-Fund to Flood-hit Areas of North Hamgyong Province
articles.content:
ASEAN Committee in DPRK Donates Aid-Fund to Flood-hit Areas of North Hamgyong Province
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The ASEAN Committee in the DPRK recently donated aid-fund to the sites for recovering from flood damage in the northern part of North Hamgyong Province.
					 Present at the donation ceremony were ambassadors of its member nations Malaysia, Vietnam, Indonesia, Laos and Cambodia in the DPRK.
					
					 The Malaysian ambassador to the DPRK who is chairman of the ASEAN Committee conveyed the aid-fund to Ri Kil Song, vice foreign minister of the DPRK, on behalf of the committee.
					
					 The Malaysian ambassador expressed deep consolation and sympathy over the big human and material losses caused by the recent flood in the northern part of North Hamgyong Province, sincerely hoping that the living of the people in the flood-hit areas would return to normal as early as possible.
					
					 Ri Kil Song expressed deep thanks to the ASEAN Committee for donating aid-fund and informed the ambassadors of the facts that the whole Party and army and all people of the DPRK have turned out as one in the rehabilitation drive in hearty response to the order of supreme leader Kim Jong Un who defined the recovery from the flood damage as the  main thrust of the 200-day campaign and that many foreign countries and international bodies are taking an active part in rendering aid on the principle of humanitarianism.
					
					 He recalled that of late the U.S. is driving a wedge in the relations favorably developing between the DPRK and Asian countries and working hard to mislead the fair international opinion.
					
					 He clarified the principled stand of the DPRK on the despicable moves of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces to make those countries friendly to the DPRK downgrade the level of diplomatic relations or sever the official ties, frightened by the tremendous political and military might of the DPRK which is daily growing stronger.
					
					 He called upon Asian countries to heighten vigilance against the hostile forces' plots and intrigues and referred to the issue of developing bilateral relations with the DPRK with a long history and tradition.
					
					 The ambassadors of the member nations of the ASEAN Committee in the DPRK said they came to have better understanding of its stand of resolutely opposing the U.S. ever more escalating sanctions and moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK. They shared the view that any country's act of forcing sovereign states to comply with its unilateral demand is absolutely intolerable as it wantonly violates the sovereign states' sovereignty and equality and principle of non-interference in their internal affairs.

articles.title: Russian Figure Visits DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Figure Visits DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Vorontsov, chief of the section for Korea and Mongolia of the Institute of Oriental Studies of Russian Academy of Sciences, visited the DPRK from October 1 to 6.
					 During his visit he laid a bouquet before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them.
					
					 He met officials of the Foreign Ministry, Ministry of External Economic Relations, Academy of Social Sciences and Kim Il Sung University and exchanged opinions and went round the construction site of Ryomyong Street, National House of Class Education, Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School, Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm and the Central Zoo.
					
					 He said that everything is going well as the Korean people are led by the great leaders through generations. He admired the change of Pyongyang in six months since his previous visit in March this year.
					
					 Witnessing the grand structures and the people full of vigor, he said the reality proved that Korea's orientation has been always right and showed the might of the DPRK achieving successes by dint of single-minded unity between the leader and the people. 
					
					 The future of the DPRK with single-minded unity is rosy, he said, and went on:
					
					 It is a clear fact that sanctions do not work on the DPRK. The U.S. and south Korean authorities say that the purpose of sanctions is to make the DPRK "give up going nuclear" but its nuclear force is becoming stronger.  The reason that the DPRK is steadily bolstering up national defence is understandable by everyone.
					
					 The sinister intention of sanctions of the U.S. and south Korean authorities is to stifle the DPRK. However, it is out of question that sanctions would not work on the DPRK whose people have achieved single-minded unity with the leader. World people know well who shut down the Kaesong Industrial Zone and who opposed dialogue. Contrary to the behavior of the south Korean authorities, there are many people in south Korea who sincerely hope for inter-Korean dialogue and improvement of the north-south relations.
					
					 Everything will go well in the DPRK where the leader and people are united in single mind, in the future, too, and the unyielding Korean people will achieve only victories despite any sanctions and pressure.

articles.title: Egyptian Military Attache Gives Reception
articles.content:
Egyptian Military Attache Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Mohamed Gamal Hassan Hosny Mohamed Sadek, military attache of the Egyptian Embassy here, hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club Thursday on the Day of Army.
					 Present there on invitation were Yun Tong Hyon, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Also on hand were Sameh Lotfi Abdelhady, Egyptian ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of his embassy.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of Kim Il Sung and his family members in Mangyongdae, the guests went round historical relics preserved with much care.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Sci-Tech Complex, the Munsu Rehabilitation Clinic, the Jangchon Vegetable Cooperative Farm in Sadong District, etc.

articles.title: Foreign Embassy Officials Visit Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification
articles.content:
Foreign Embassy Officials Visit Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification
Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Officials in charge of cultural and friendly relations of foreign embassies here Thursday visited the Monument to the Three Charters for National Reunification on the ninth anniversary of the October 4 declaration and the 36th anniversary of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo. 
					Being briefed on the monument which was built wonderfully, they went round the tower, group of subsidiary theme sculptures, etc.
					
					Meanwhile, they visited the Holy Taekwon-Do Hall and enjoyed demonstration of Taekwon-Do players of the DPRK.

articles.title: First-phase Project of Honggondo Tideland Completed
articles.content:
First-phase Project of Honggondo Tideland Completed
 Sonchon, October 6 (KCNA) -- The first-phase project of the Honggondo Tideland was completed.
					 A creation of a great transformation of nature along the coast of the West Sea is the eternal treasure for the country's prosperity produced by the death-defying struggle of the heroic Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il working class in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development.
					
					 The completion ceremony took place on the spot Thursday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kwak Pom Gi, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and officials and employees of the North Phyongan Provincial Tideland Reclamation Complex.
					
					Kim Nung O, chairman of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, in his address said the tens of ri-long dam extending across the rough sea and 4,500 hectares of reclaimed tideland are produced as the fruition of the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He called upon the builders of the complex to create world-startling heroic miracles in the second-phase project of Honggondo Tideland and glorify the honor of being a model unit in the struggle for implementing the decision of the Seventh Congress of the WPK.

articles.title: Officials and Members of Women's Union Meet
articles.content:
Officials and Members of Women's Union Meet
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea held a public presentation of noble virtues of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu at the Hall of Women on Thursday on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 71st founding anniversary of the WPK.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the WPK, Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, and its officials and members in Pyongyang. 
					
					 Speakers said that the WPK, founded and developed by the great leaders, is the Party of the leader and the Juche-type revolutionary party guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.
					
					 They said the exploits the great leaders performed by laying the strong foundation for the Party building and activities, victoriously leading the cause of the Juche revolution and the Songun revolution and bringing about a bright future for building a socialist power would remain shining forever.
					
					 The WPK is demonstrating its might as the eternal Party of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as it has Marshal Kim Jong Un at the helm of the Party and revolution, they said.
					
					 They called upon all the officials and members of the women's union to creditably fulfill their duties as the Korean women in the general advance for hastening the building of a socialist power, remaining true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Agricultural Workers and Members of UAWK Meet
articles.content:
Agricultural Workers and Members of UAWK Meet
 Ryongchon, October 6 (KCNA) -- Agricultural workers and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) held a meeting at the Jangsan Co-op Farm in Ryongshon County, North Phyongan Province on Thursday to celebrate the 19th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's election as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and its 71st founding anniversary.
					 Attending the meeting were officials concerned, agricultural workers and members of the union.
					
					 Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the union, made a report which was followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Jong Il led the party and the revolution for a long period that lasted over a half century and devoted his all to the revolutionary party building and the struggle for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche pioneered by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The hot emulation among model cooperative farms in Songun era personally organized by Kim Jong Il enlivened the whole country with dynamic drive for a radical turn in agricultural revolution to bring about leap forward in the agricultural production and turned the countryside into the socialist fairyland, they said, adding:
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un saw to it that the party work and activities were conducted, holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal head of the WPK, thus making sure that Kim Jong Il's glorious history of leading the party building is endlessly carried forward.
					
					 They stressed the need to dynamically launch the accurately targeted method of political work and socialist emulation for increased production to significantly greet the 8th Congress of the union.

articles.title: Pyongyang International Conference on Promoting Sustainable Development Held
articles.content:
Pyongyang International Conference on Promoting Sustainable Development Held
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang International Conference on Promoting Sustainable Development was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday and Thursday.
					 Present there were officials of relevant units of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection, the Ministry of Agriculture, the Ministry of Urban Management and the State General Bureau of Tourism, and teachers and researchers of science and education institutions.
					
					 Also present were Prof. Kyung-Ae Park at University of British Columbia in Canada who doubles as director of the Canada-DPRK knowledge partnership program and experts from Malaysia, U.S., China, India and UK and staff members of foreign diplomatic missions and missions of international organizations here.
					
					 Speakers said that the environment protection is an important work to guarantee the sustainability of the country's economic development and promote the wellbeing of people and posterity.
					
					 They noted that the conference would contribute to broadening the views of experts, helping develop the world in a sustainable way and boosting international exchange and cooperation.
					
					 The conference was divided into the panels of climate change, sustainable development of agriculture, forestry management, water resources management, management of wastes and sustainable development of tourism.
					
					 Speakers explained the achievements and experience gained in working out the strategy for sustainable development by protecting environment.
					
					 The conference marked a significant occasion in exchanging beneficial views on the issues arising in laying the foundation for sustainable development and acquiring broad knowledge.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark 90th Anniversary of DIU
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Opens to Mark 90th Anniversary of DIU
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Korean Art Gallery Thursday to celebrate the 90th anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					 Displayed at the venue of the exhibition were fine art pieces dealing with the exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for party building.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of ministries and national institutions, creators in the field of fine art and working people in Pyongyang.

articles.title: Transport of Relief Goods by Ship Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Transport of Relief Goods by Ship Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The marine transport of relief materials to flood-hit North Hamgyong Province is gaining momentum in the DPRK.
					 The Ministry of Land and Maritime Transport launched a campaign for carrying to the disaster areas many relief goods, building materials and machines from Wonsan and Hungnam ports, with general mobilization of all vessels on the east sea.
					
					 The ministry has done all the works ranging from the entry to discharging under a meticulous plan.
					
					 At present, heavily laden ships arrive in Chongjin Port everyday.

articles.title: Results of Recovery Efforts in Disaster Areas
articles.content:
Results of Recovery Efforts in Disaster Areas
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The housing construction is progressing apace in Kyonghung County, one of the flood-hit areas in North Hamgyong Province of the DPRK.
					 By October 2, wall-building for more than 200 flats was finished while the plastering for 50 blocks of dwelling houses came to a close and the floor concrete tamping was carried out at 60 percent.
					
					 The soldier-builders in charge of housing construction in the county produced tens of thousands of blocks only in one day, removed mud of several thousand cubic meters in two days and finished the foundation work for houses in a matter of one day.

articles.title: Cement Production Goes Up in DPRK
articles.content:
Cement Production Goes Up in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Sangwon Cement Complex in the DPRK takes the lead in the production of cement urgently needed for the flood damage rehabilitation in the country's northern part.
					 In hearty response to the Workers' Party of Korea's call for all-out recovery efforts, the employees of the complex have boosted the cement output 1.5 times to supply several thousand tons of cement to the disaster areas in a day.
					
					 Up to now the complex sent more than 70,000 tons of cement to flood-hit North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 Last year the complex had honor of receiving a congratulatory message from supreme leader Kim Jong Un by surpassing the level of peak year in production.

articles.title: Wangjaesan Art Troupe Performs in Kim Chaek City
articles.content:
Wangjaesan Art Troupe Performs in Kim Chaek City
 Chongjin, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Wangjaesan Art Troupe performed in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province from Oct. 4 to 6.
					 The performance began with music "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu". Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as songs, dances and instrumental music.
					
					 In female chorus "Our Comrade Kim Jong Un" and female duet "His Humanity" the artistes truthfully represented the reverence for supreme leader Kim Jong Un who is making devoted efforts to provide warm cradles to the people in the afflicted areas of the northern part of the country as early as possible and turn the areas into a fairyland in the era of the Workers' Party.
					
					 Female solo and pangchang "It Is Offensive" and light music "Higher and Faster" encouraged the officials, party members and other working people in the city in their high-pitched drive for a surge in production so as to win miraculous victory in the campaign for recovering from the flood damage by turning the adversity into favorable conditions. 
					
					 Also put on the stage were national dances, tap dances and modern dances.

articles.title: Historical Relics and Remains Discovered in DPRK
articles.content:
Historical Relics and Remains Discovered in DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Historical relics and remains dating back to the primitive and ancient times have been recently unearthed in Ungsang-dong, Rason City of the DPRK.
					 The discoveries include a stone relic dating back to the primitive age, two dolmens and a home site dating back to the ancient age and more than 1,000 pieces of remains.
					
					 The stone relic consisting of rocks, located on the beach, is three meters high and covers an area of 80 square meters.
					
					 One of the two dolmens is 120 cm long, 84 cm wide and 60 cm deep with its flat stone 302 cm in length, 228 cm in width and 62 cm in thickness. The other is made up of two upright stones, each 100 cm in height, and a flat stone 180 cm in length, 140 cm in width and 60 cm in thickness.
					
					 Discovered at the dolmens were semi-processed stone goods and brown undecorated vessels.
					
					 Found out at the home site of new style in structure were tens of potteries and cooking site.
					
					 Those relics and remains are of weight significance in ascertaining the features of the ancient culture in northeastern Korea.

articles.title: North Hwanghae Province Releases Many Pheasants and Deer into Mountains
articles.content:
North Hwanghae Province Releases Many Pheasants and Roe Deer into Mountains
Sariwon, October 6 (KCNA) -- North Hwanghae Province of the DPRK released at least 10,000 pheasants and over 100 baby roe deer into mountains of Yonthan, Sohung and Rinsan counties, etc. on Oct. 6.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces' Sanctions against DPRK Are Last-ditch Efforts of Those Facing Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces' Sanctions against DPRK Are Last-ditch Efforts of Those Facing Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces' hysteric anti-DPRK sanctions are the last-ditch efforts of those terror-stricken by the invincible might of the DPRK which ranked itself among the world's nuclear powers, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in an article.
					 The hostile forces' provocative and military threat and sanctions are nothing but desperate efforts to get rid of the abyss of final ruin as they are little short of admitting themselves the failure of their hostile policy toward the DPRK, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK has firmly defended socialism, holding high the banner of Songun, the banner of self-reliance and self-development, and ranked itself among the nuclear powers despite the unprecedented ceaseless political and military pressure and economic sanctions by the U.S. and its vassal forces.
					
					 The sanctions and pressure ratcheted up by the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group of traitors in disregard of the strategic position of the DPRK and the trend of the times would only harden the will of the DPRK to take a thousand-fold strong counteraction. 
					
					 The Park group, extremely scared by a series of measures being taken by the DPRK for bolstering up the capability for self-defense in succession, are running wild like burnt wolves, crying out for getting "ready to finish off" someone and "meting out severe punishment" to someone but it is nothing but the last-ditch efforts of those doomed to perish.
					
					 Neither sanctions nor pressure on the part of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces can work on the DPRK. They will only push the DPRK to bolster up nuclear deterrence for self-defense and heighten the spirit of the self-reliance and self-development of its service personnel and people.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Puppet Diplomatic Chief's Mud-slinging at DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts S. Korean Puppet Diplomatic Chief's Mud-slinging at DPRK
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Traitor Yun Pyong Se, south Korean puppet foreign minister, speaking at the recent UN General Assembly, asserted that  "the north has customarily violated UN resolutions." He went the lengths of raving that "it is necessary to consider if the north is qualified to be a member of the UN".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says that what Yun uttered was nothing but jargons spouted by him, troubled by the nightmare and the sense of setbacks that with nothing can the puppet group stop the north from bolstering up its nuclear force.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 His vituperations were also prompted by the puppet group's cynical ploy to calm down the bitter criticism of their bankrupt confrontation policy and shore up the ruling crisis shaking to its very foundation.
					
					 It is entirely just for the DPRK to firmly protect its sovereignty and interests from the nuclear blackmail, strong-arm actions and arbitrary practices of the imperialists disturbing the peace of the world and the security of mankind in disregard of even international law. There is no reason for the U.S. and its vassal forces to take issue with the DPRK's actions.
					
					 Moreover, the DPRK's access to nukes was an inevitable option to put an end to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK and the threat of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula pursuant to the policy.
					
					 The puppet regime has gone reckless in the moves to tarnish the image of the DPRK, but they only throw into bold relief the wretched plight of the puppet forces who are now tight-cornered, isolated, denounced and forsaken by the south Korean people from all walks of life and the international community.
					
					 Ever more lamentable shrill cries are heard from the Park Geun Hye group of traitors. This clearly proves that the DPRK's cause is now making more dynamic progress and the day of final victory for its service members and civilians is drawing near.

articles.title: S. Korean Peasant Killed by Water Cannon
articles.content:
S. Korean Peasant Killed by Water Cannon
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean on-line paper Voice of People on Oct. 2 in an editorial said that peasant Paek Nam Gi was killed by the direct firing of water cannon.
					 The editorial referred to the announcement of a report on the result of investigation by the ad hoc committee of the hospital of Seoul National University over the controversial diagnosis of the death of peasant Paek Nam Gi.
					
					 Paek died of a bruise on his head and, accordingly, the death style was the one by outside factor, the editorial held.
					
					 Noting that the assailant responsible for the death of Paek should be certainly punished, it said, charging that the assailant is none other than the police.

articles.title: U.S., S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Kick off North-targeted War Maneuvers in Hotspot Waters in West Sea of Korea
articles.content:
U.S., S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Kick off North-targeted War Maneuvers in Hotspot Waters in West Sea of Korea
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressor forces and the marine forces of the south Korean puppet army are staging the north-targeted war maneuvers on Paekryong Island and Yonphyong Island, the biggest hotspots in the West Sea of Korea, from the end of September.
					 This was announced by the command of the puppet marine forces on Oct. 4.
					
					 No sooner had the Third Marine Task Group of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces arrived at south Korea than it formed a combined unit with the Sixth Marine Brigade of the puppet army and is busying with war maneuvers for aggression including tactical drill, drill for guiding airplanes, etc. against the DPRK.
					
					 The Third Marine Task Group stationed in Okinawa, Japan is the aggression forces which will be dispatched before any other forces in case of contingency on the Korean peninsula, according to OPLAN 5027, a scenario for a war against the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Unpopular Rule under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Unpopular Rule under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) --- An all-people rally took place in Seoul on Oct. 1 under the sponsorship of the Headquarters of 2016 People's All-out Action and the Headquarters of Struggle for Paek Nam Gi in south Korea.
					 Attending it were civic and public organizations including the Confederation of Trade Unions and the April 16 Solidarity and citizens and other people of all social standings, more than 30 000 in all.
					
					 At the rally speakers said that general strikes of workers against the introduction of the system of paying salaries according to piece rate are at full swing despite the repression by the regime, and citizens are proactively supporting them.
					
					 They demanded the authorities abolish the administrative guidelines related to labor, revise the special law on probing the truth about the ferry Sewol disaster and enforce a special investigation.
					
					 Prior to it, teachers under the Teachers Union held a large-scale rally in Seoul.
					
					 They demanded the authorities abolish the "system of estimating teachers" and revise the "law on teachers union".

articles.title: Ending Park Geun Hye Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ending Park Geun Hye Regime Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean on-line paper Minjok Ilbo in an editorial on Sept. 29 called for ending the Park Geun Hye regime through the people's all-out action.
					 The Park regime killed another man, the editorial said.
					
					The people's right to existence has been driven into a cliff due to the incompetence, scandals of the Park regime and economic crisis caused by them, it deplored.
					
					 It condemned Park for attempting to make an autopsy in a bid to fake up the case, far from making an apology before the late.
					
					 It called upon all people to turn out as one to put an end to the Park regime.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The South Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a grand chorus rally for peace on Oct. 4, the ninth anniversary of the October 4 declaration, according to the south Korean on-line paper OhmyNews.
					 Kim Yong Man, permanent representative of the headquarters, in a speech said the military confrontation and standoff on the Korean peninsula have reached an extreme phase, adding now is the high time that peace is realized on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Incense-burning Altar for Paek Nam Gi Set up in Taejon, S. Korea
articles.content:
Incense-burning Altar for Paek Nam Gi Set up in Taejon, S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Taejon Movement Headquarters for Defending Democracy set up an incense-burning altar outside the Taejon City Office on Oct. 4, according to the south Korean on-line paper Tongil News.
					 A press conference was held before the operation of the incense-burning altar.
					
					 Speakers said they set up the incense-burning altar to honor the memory of peasant Paek Nam Gi and probe the truth about the bestial killing by the Park Geun Hye regime and demand the punishment of those responsible for it.
					
					 A press release was read out.
					
					 It said it has been clearly confirmed through video and hearing that the direct cause of the death of Paek Nam Gi was the firing of the murderous water cannon by the police.
					
					 It called upon the people from all walks of life to turn out in the actions to punish the Park regime going against the people's mindset.

articles.title: Workers' Sit-in Strike Escalates in S. Korea
articles.content:
Workers' Sit-in Strike Escalates in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- More than 30 000 workers in the public sector of south Korea held a rally in Seoul on October 4 at a time when the general strike of workers in protest against the authorities' unpopular policy is gaining in scope and strength, according to the south Korean internet paper Chamsesang. 
					 Speakers at the rally said the workers in the public sector are bravely implementing their action plan, calling for totally nullifying the introduction of the system for paying wages according to piece rate as early as possible.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. held a ceremony to mark the ninth anniversary of the October 4 declaration on Oct. 2 under the sponsorship of the New York Regional Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					 Kim Tae Chang, chairman of the regional committee, in an opening address called for invariably keeping the viability of the reunification movement.
					
					 There screened a video showing the days when the historic declaration was published in October, 2007.
					
					 Then, "Declaration for Development of North-South Relations and Peace and Prosperity" was read out.
					
					 A congratulatory message from the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and addresses of solidarity from the South Side Committee and the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration were introduced.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony there took place an event for peaceful reunification of the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Federation of Koreans in U.S.
articles.content:
Anniversary of October 4 Declaration Marked by Federation of Koreans in U.S.
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a statement on Oct. 4 said the October 4 declaration which was published in the wake of the June 15 joint declaration is a precious declaration for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
					 The statement denounced the U.S., Japan and the Park Geun Hye regime for resorting to the vicious hostile policy toward the DPRK including war moves, smear campaign and sanctions.
					
					 It said that no one can block the reunification of Korea.
					
					 Korea's reunification should be achieved without fail under the banner of independent reunification and great national unity, it noted, and continued:
					
					 We will carry out the joint declarations despite any ordeal, convinced of the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Int'l Community Hopes for Korea's Reunification: Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Int'l Community Hopes for Korea's Reunification: Nigerian Body
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article titled "Invariable banner of Korea's reunification movement" on its website on September 27.
					 The article said:
					
					 The north-south summit took place in Pyongyang in June 2000 for the first time in the history of the division of the Korean nation and the June 15 joint declaration was adopted. It was a noteworthy event which brought a radical turn in the movement for Korea's reunification.
					
					 The June 15 joint declaration is the foundation for improvement of inter-Korean relations and great programme for Korea's reunification as it clarifies the ideological foundation, basic principle and practical way for national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 The October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, was adopted in 2007, opening up the rosier prospect for the reunification movement of the Korean nation.
					
					 However, the Park Geun Hye regime of south Korea took the lead in the international sanctions racket following the U.S., which pulled up the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purpose, and totally shut down the Kaesong Industrial Zone that had barely been operated, thus driving the inter-Korean relations to a total stalemate.
					
					 Now the Korean nation is staging the nationwide struggle to open an era of peace, reunification and prosperity by implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 International community sincerely hopes that the Korean nation will reunify the country as early as possible under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and consolidate peace and stability on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Russian Newspaper Introduces Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia
articles.content:
Russian Newspaper Introduces Kim Jong Il's Visit to Russia
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Russian internet paper Bremya Peremyon on September 27 carried a special write-up with photos of leader Kim Jong Il visiting the Russian Federation.
					 An article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il visiting Russia" said:
					
					 During the visit to the Far Eastern Region of Russia in August 2002, leader Kim Jong Il went round St. Bishop Innokenty of Irkutsk Church, Russian Orthodox Church.
					
					 There sounded a bell when he was going round the church, being briefed on history of the Russian Orthodox Church that hosts various ceremonies. At that time the priest told him "Now a bell is sounded to welcome leader Kim Jong Il. The sun has come to our church. It is natural to sound a bell when the sun has come."
					
					 It was a great event in the history of international politics that leader Kim Jong Il visited Lenin Mausoleum at the Red Square in Moscow in August 2001.
					
					 He visited Lenin Mausoleum to lay a wreath and pay tribute to him despite the scorching heat, saying that he would visit the mausoleum with moral sense of obligation of a genuine revolutionary, irrespective of diplomatic customs and any conditions.
					
					 Not only Russians but also world people admired leader Kim Jong Il's boundless morality and sense of obligation upon the news that he visited Lenin Mausoleum.

articles.title: WPK Anniversary Marked Abroad
articles.content:
WPK Anniversary Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- Events took place in the Czech Republic, Denmark and Switzerland on September 30 and October 1 with the approach of the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Present at the events were personages of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, the Communist Party in Denmark, the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, the Swiss preparatory committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and masses.
					
					 Iri Vabr, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, in his speech said that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il steadily strengthened the position and role of the WPK and victoriously led the Korean revolution by achieving unity and cohesion of the Party.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said Kim Il Sung set forth the unique policy for party building in the first period of the revolution and achieved the historic cause of the party building after the liberation of the country. Under his leadership the WPK has successfully fulfilled the mission and role as the guiding force of the revolution.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, said Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il built the WPK into the genuine mother party serving the people.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the events.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of WPK Celebrated by Organization of DR Congo
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of WPK Celebrated by Organization of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo issued a bulletin on Sept. 30 on the 71st founding anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 The bulletin in an article said:
					
					 From the outset of his embarking upon the road of revolution, President Kim Il Sung paid big efforts to making preparations for the party founding and founded the revolutionary party of the popular masses for the first time in history.
					
					 Under his wise guidance the WPK set a world's example in building the revolutionary party and performed immortal feats for the cause of the popular masses for independence.
					
					 The WPK founded and led by him further developed thanks to HE Kim Jong Il.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il strengthened the WPK into the party of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Under the guidance of HE Kim Jong Il the WPK could triumphantly advance overcoming all trials of history and firmly defend Korean-style socialism under the unfurled banner of Songun.
					
					 The DPRK is dynamically advancing to bring earlier the victory of the cause of the Juche revolution under the wise leadership of HE Kim Jong Un, chairman of the WPK, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The WPK will always win victory as it is led by him.

articles.title: Tower of Juche Idea Introduced by Italian Personage
articles.content:
Tower of Juche Idea Introduced by Italian Personage
 Pyongyang, October 6 (KCNA) -- The Italian newspaper Parma Daily on September 26 carried an article titled "Tower of Juche Idea in Pyongyang" dedicated by the head of a delegation of the Italian Group for the Study of the Juche Idea who visited the DPRK recently.
					 The article said:
					
					 The Juche idea was founded by President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 I had a deep understanding of the Juche idea during my stay in Korea.
					
					 The Juche idea is the man-centered theory.
					
					 The DPRK guided by the Juche idea is protecting the sovereignty of the country and nation in reliance on its strong military muscle and achieved the harmonious whole of the party, army and people.
					
					 The Tower of the Juche Idea is the one of the most magnificent monuments in the DPRK.
					
					 Noting the tower was unveiled in April, 1982 to mark the 70th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung, the article introduced its scale, style and symbolic meaning.

articles.title: Portavoz del MINREX denuncia la campana anti-RPDC de la banda de Obama
articles.content:
Portavoz del MINREX denuncia la campana anti-RPDC de la banda de Obama
Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ACNC) -- Ahora llega al climax la campana de sancion y presion de la banda de Obama contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea. 
					Al respecto, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC publico el dia 6 una declaracion que sigue:
					
					En lugar de aprender la leccion del fracaso de su politica sobre la RPDC, la banda de Obama no deja de amenazarla y chantajearla en el plano militar acusando atrevidamente hasta la dignidad de su Direccion Suprema y expone abiertamente la intencion de "derrocar" su regimen socialista.
					
					Al mismo tiempo, hace todo lo posible para aislar y aplastar a la RPDC obligando a los Estados soberanos a romper las relaciones con esta o rebajar su nivel. 
					
					Esto no pasa de ser esfuerzos agonicos de los que sufrieron derrotas sucesivas en la confrontacion politica y militar con la RPDC. 
					
					La banda de Obama, grupo de bribones, esgrime el garrote de sancion hostigando a los paises, que no le obedecen, y despreciando el principio universal del derecho internacional que estipula que un Estado soberano no puede ser en ningun caso el blanco de jurisdiccion de otro pais. 
					
					Para defenderse frente a la banda de bandidos que insatisfecha por la presion politico-economica y la amenaza militar sin precedentes, realiza esfuerzos desesperados por imponer hasta la calamidad nuclear, nuestro pais definio el armamento nuclear como linea del Estado, vino consolidando en lo cualitativo y cuantitativo las fuerzas armadas nucleares y ya se convirtio en la potencia con alta capacidad de ataque nuclear.
					
					 Los imperialistas estadounidenses, que actuan como fieras para eliminar a la RPDC negando la soberania y el derecho a vivir de esta, volveran en si solo cuando sean castigados con palizas.
					
					 En un futuro cercano, EE.UU. vera la realidad terrible en que su punta de lanza para acabar con la vida de la RPDC producira el efecto contrario de matar a si mismo.

articles.title: Comite de ASEAN en RPDC dona fondos para la reparacion de danos por inundaciones
articles.content:
Comite de ASEAN en RPDC dona fondos para la reparacion de danos por inundaciones
Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ACNC) -- El Comite de ASEAN acreditado en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dono fondos al campo de reparacion de danos en las zonas septentrionales de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte.
					En la ceremonia de entrega participaron los embajadores de Malasia, Vietnam, Indonesia, Laos y Camboya, paises miembros del Comite de ASEAN en Corea. 
					
					En representacion del Comite, el embajador malasio, quien lo preside, entrego la donacion al vicecanciller coreano Ri Kil Song. 
					
					El embajador malasio expreso consuelo y compasion por las enormes perdidas humanas y materiales causadas por inundaciones en las zonas septentrionales de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte de la RPDC y deseo de corazon que se estabilice cuanto antes la vida de los habitantes afectados. 
					
					Ri Kil Song expreso profundo agradecimiento al Comite de ASEAN por la donacion de fondos e informo con datos concretos que en acato a la orden del Presidente Kim Jong Un, quien determino el resarcimiento de danos como rumbo principal de la campana de 200 dias, todo el partido, todo el ejercito y todo el pueblo se han movilizado como un solo hombre en esa tarea y que muchos paises del mundo y varias organizaciones internacionales brindan ayuda sincera en el principio humanitario. 
					
					Revelo que ultimamente, EE.UU. intenta sembrar cizanas en las relaciones en desarrollo favorable entre la RPDC y otros paises asiaticos e inducir en error la imparcial opinion publica mundial.
					
					Y manifesto la posicion de principios de la RPDC sobre el hecho de que EE.UU. y los titeres surcoreanos, aturdidos ante el creciente poderio politico y militar de la RPDC, maniobran suciamente para que los paises con relaciones amistosas con la RPDC rebajen el nivel de relaciones diplomaticas o las rompan. 
					
					Insistio en que los paises asiaticos deben elevar la vigilancia sobre los complots de las fuerzas hostiles y desarrollar las relaciones bilaterales con la RPDC que tienen larga historia y tradicion.
					
					Los embajadores de los paises miembros del Comite de ASEAN subrayaron que pudieron conocer mejor la posicion de la RPDC contra la creciente sancion y campana de aislamiento y aplastamiento de EE.UU.
					
					Coincidieron en no permitir que se impongan las demandas unilaterales a los Estados soberanos que resultan grave violacion de la soberania, el derecho de igualdad y el principio de no intervencion en asuntos internos de ellos.

articles.title: Inaugurada primera etapa de marisma de Honggondo
articles.content:
Inaugurada primera etapa de marisma de Honggondo
Sonchon, 6 de octubre (ACNC) -- Termino la construccion de primera etapa de la marisma de Honggondo.
					El polder extendido a la orilla del Mar Oeste constituye el patrimonio de la patria, preparado por el espiritu de autofortalecimiento y la lucha decisiva de la heroica clase obrera Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il.
					
					Tuvo lugar en el terreno el dia 6 la ceremonia inaugural de la primera etapa de la marisma.
					
					En la ocasion tomaron parte el vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kwak Pom Gi, los funcionarios de la rama interesada y los funcionarios y empleados del Complejo de Construccion de Polderes de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra inaugural, el presidente del Comite del Partido del Trabajo de Corea en la susodicha provincia, Kim Nung O dijo que se extendio en medio del mar el dique de decenas de ries (10 ries equivalen a 4km) formando una marisma de 4 mil 500 hectareas, lo cual se debe a la sabia direccion de los grandes Lideres antecesores y el Presidente Kim Jong Un.
					
					Exhorto a los constructores del Complejo a crear el mito heroico asombroso en la construccion de segunda etapa de la marisma para glorificar de continuo el honor de la unidad prototipo en la campana para materializar la resolucion adoptada en el VII Congreso del Partido.

articles.title: Tiene lugar Conferencia Internacional de Pyongyang sobre el Desarrollo Sostenible
articles.content:
Tiene lugar Conferencia Internacional de Pyongyang sobre el Desarrollo Sostenible
Pyongyang, 6 de octubre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar los dias 5 y 6 en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la Conferencia Internacional de Pyongyang sobre la Promocion del Desarrollo Sostenible en la RPDC. 
					Asistieron aqui los funcionarios del Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental, el de Agricultura, el de Urbanismo, la Direccion Nacional de Turismo y otros dominios relacionados, los profesores e investigadores de las instituciones de ciencia y educacion. 
					
					Se distinguian tambien Kyung-Ae Park, profesora de la Universidad British Columbia de Canada y directora del Programa de Intercambio y Cooperacion de Conocimientos Canada-RPDC, los especialistas de Malasia, Estados Unidos, China, la India y Gran Bretana, y los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y de organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en la RPDC. 
					
					En la ocasion hubo discursos. 
					
					Los oradores dijeron que la proteccion medioambiental es una labor importante para asegurar el caracter sostenible de desarrollo economico del pais y fomentar el bienestar del hombre y las generaciones venideras. 
					
					Enfatizaron que la cita permitira ampliar la vision de los especialistas y promover el desarrollo sostenible del mundo y contribuira a intensificar el intercambio y la cooperacion internacionales. 
					
					Las secciones de la conferencia fueron el cambio climatico, el desarrollo sostenible de agricultura, la proteccion forestal, el cuidado de recursos acuaticos, el tratamiento de residuos y el desarrollo sostenible de turismo. 
					
					Se presentaron los exitos y experiencias adquiridos en la elaboracion de la estrategia de desarrollo sostenible mediante la proteccion del medioambiente. 
					
					La conferencia fue una oportunidad importante para intercambiar las opiniones provechosas sobre los problemas, que se presentan en el establecimiento de la base de desarrollo sostenible, y asimilar los conocimientos profundos.
